com.mordoch.chemtools

Class Analysis

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mordoch.chemtools.Analysis

  • public abstract class Analysis
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains tools for analysis, i.e. finding empirical formula given percent composition.

    All methods are static; this class is abstract.

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0.2
    Author:
    Ariel Mordoch
    See Also:
    Run

    • Method Detail

      • empiricalFromPercentComposition

        public static java.lang.String empiricalFromPercentComposition(double percent1,
                                               double percent2,
                                               double percent3,
                                               double molarMass1,
                                               double molarMass2,
                                               double molarMass3,
                                               java.lang.String element1,
                                               java.lang.String element2,
                                               java.lang.String element3)

        Method has not been verified to work correctly.

        This method takes 3 percents and 3 elements and finds the empirical formula for a compound containing those elements.

        Note that this method does not check whether one of the normalized subscripts are decimals.

        An additional method of the same name can find the empirical formula of a compound with three elements rather than two.
        Parameters:
        percent1 - the percent of element 1 in compound X
        percent2 - the percent of a second element in compound X
        percent3 - the percent of a third element in compound X
        molarMass1 - molar mass of the first element in compound X
        molarMass2 - molar mass of the second element in compound X
        molarMass3 - molar mass of the third element in compound X
        element1 - the element corresponding to percent1
        element2 - the element corresponding to percent2
        element3 - the element corresponding to percent3
        Returns:
        empirical formula without correction for decimal subscripts.
        Since:
        1.0

      • empiricalFromPercentComposition

        public static java.lang.String empiricalFromPercentComposition(double percent1,
                                               double percent2,
                                               double molarMass1,
                                               double molarMass2,
                                               java.lang.String element1,
                                               java.lang.String element2)

        Method has not been verified to work correctly.

        This method takes 2 percents and 2 elements and finds the empirical formula for a compound containing those elements.

        Note that this method does not check whether one of the normalized subscripts are decimals.

        An additional method of the same name can find the empirical formula of a compound with three elements rather than two.
        Parameters:
        percent1 - the percent of element 1 in compound X
        percent2 - the percent of a second element in compound X
        molarMass1 - molar mass of the first element in compound X
        molarMass2 - molar mass of the second element in compound X
        element1 - the element corresponding to percent1
        element2 - the element corresponding to percent2
        Returns:
        empirical formula without correction for decimal subscripts.
        Since:
        1.0.1

      • empiricalFromMass

        public static java.lang.String empiricalFromMass(double mass1,
                                 double mass2,
                                 double mass3,
                                 double molarMass1,
                                 double molarMass2,
                                 double molarMass3,
                                 java.lang.String element1,
                                 java.lang.String element2,
                                 java.lang.String element3)

        Method has not been verified to work correctly.

        This method takes the total mass of a compound and its three elements and determines the empirical formula of that compound. Employs the empiricalFromPercentComposition method to work.

        Note that this method does not check whether one of the normalized subscripts are decimals.

        An additional method of the same name can find the empirical formula of a compound with two elements rather than three.
        Parameters:
        mass1 - the mass of an element in compound X
        mass2 - the mass of a second element in compound X
        mass3 - the mass of a third element in compound X
        molarMass1 - molar mass of the first element in compound X
        molarMass2 - molar mass of the second element in compound X
        molarMass3 - molar mass of the third element in compound X
        element1 - the element that corresponds to mass1
        element2 - the element that corresponds to mass2
        element3 - the element that corresponds to mass3
        Returns:
        empirical formula, without correcting for decimal subscripts
        Since:
        1.0.1

      • empiricalFromMass

        public static java.lang.String empiricalFromMass(double mass1,
                                 double mass2,
                                 double molarMass1,
                                 double molarMass2,
                                 java.lang.String element1,
                                 java.lang.String element2)

        Method has not been verified to work correctly.

        This method takes the total mass of a compound and its two elements and determines the empirical formula of that compound. Employs the empiricalFromPercentComposition method to work.

        Note that this method does not check whether one of the normalized subscripts are decimals.

        An additional method of the same name can find the empirical formula of a compound with three elements rather than two.
        Parameters:
        mass1 - the mass of an element in compound X
        mass2 - the mass of a second element in compound X
        molarMass1 - molar mass of the first element in compound X
        molarMass2 - molar mass of the second element in compound X
        element1 - the element that corresponds to mass1
        element2 - the element that corresponds to mass2
        Returns:
        empirical formula, without correcting for decimal subscripts
        Since:
        1.0.1

      • molecularFromEmpirical

        public static int[] molecularFromEmpirical(double molarMassCompound,
                           double molarMassEmpirical,
                           int[] subscripts)

        Method has not been verified to work correctly.

        This method takes the molar mass of a compound, the molar mass of its empirical formula, and an array of the empirical formula's subscripts. It returns the subscripts of the molecular formula.
        Parameters:
        molarMassCompound - the molar mass of a compound
        molarMassEmpirical - the molar mass of a compound's empirical formula
        subscripts - an array containing the empirical formula subscripts
        Returns:
        an array containing the molecular formula's subscripts
        Since:
        1.0.2
